issue.body:

comments.body:
Added the Rare/Elite/Boss condition, but the creature type one is a little trickier, as the only way to obtain this information returns it in localized form. You can still make it work, but you will just need to use the Lua condition type. Import the following import string as a starting point (new feature in r69), making sure to substitute all names like "Humanoid" with their localized counterparts after importing:

``` ^1^T^SUnit^S^SType^S^SConditions^T^N1^T^SRunes^T^t^SType^SLUA^SChecked^b^SPrtsAfter^N0^SOperator^S==^SName^SUnitCreatureFamily("target")~`==~`"Humanoid"^SUnit^Splayer^SPrtsBefore^N0^SLevel^N0^SIcon^S^SAndOr^SAND^t^N2^T^SRunes^T^t^SType^SLUA^SChecked^b^SPrtsAfter^N0^SOperator^S~|=^SName^SUnitCreatureFamily("target")~`==~`"Dragonkin"~`or~`UnitCreatureFamily("target")~`==~`"Beast"^SUnit^Splayer^SPrtsBefore^N0^SLevel^N0^SIcon^S^SAndOr^SOR^t^N3^T^SRunes^T^t^SType^SLUA^SChecked^b^SPrtsAfter^N0^SOperator^S==^SName^SUnitCreatureFamily("target")~`~|=~`"Demon"^SUnit^Splayer^SPrtsBefore^N0^SLevel^N0^SIcon^S^SAndOr^SOR^t^t^SName^S^t^N41403^^ ```

Note that players are not considered to be of any creature type, similar to slimes and oozes.

Edited May 13, 2011
